newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - March 24.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - March 24.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

BHP said it was actively looking at realising its investment in Foster's Brewing Group, but could not say if this would be achieved by the end of the resource giant's financial year on May 31. BHP chief executive John Prescott also said BHP had closed its Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea, steel processing centre and evacuated some dependents due to security concerns.

RTZ Corp Plc-CRA Ltd said on Sunday that it did not regard the Bougainville copper mine at the centre of the political turmoil in Papua New Guinea as a lost cause. "No, it's not - it's still a very, very important asset ... and we still would like to go back there," said RTZ-CRA chief executive Leon Davis when asked by a television interviewer if Bougainville was a lost cause.
James Hardie Industries Ltd said on Friday it had sold its bathroom products division to GWA International Ltd at a price that would realise book value.
MIM Holdings Ltd said on Friday it had agreed to sell 80 percent of its Mount Isa power station to the Queensland state goverment's electricity division. Terms were not disclosed.
